intro: Bupleurum tenuissimum f. sartorianum, commonly known as the Sartorianum angelica, is a rare and distinctive botanical variant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
